Operations Performed

  • Colonoscopy, flexible, proximal to splenic flexure; diagnostic, with or without collection of specimen(s) by brushing or washing, with or without colon decompression (separate procedure) (45378)

Surgeon

  • Gastroenterology Surgery, MD

Date of surgery

  • Thursday, December 20, 2012

Preoperative Diagnosis

  • Internal hemorrhoids without mention of complication (455.0)

Postoperative Diagnosis

  • Internal hemorrhoids without mention of complication (455.0)

Indications for Surgery

Indications

  • See diagnosis

Risk and Consent

Risk Factors

  • None

ASA Physical Status

  • Class I. Normal healthy patient

Informed Consent

  • Yes: Indications for surgical procedure, risks, benefits, possible complications explained to patient including alternatives in treatment. Patient had the chance to ask questions and all were answered to their satisfaction. Patient understood and gave consent.

Operative Findings

Operative Findings

  • Normal Colon
  • No Polyps
  • No signs of Cancer

Preparation

Anesthesia

  • Topical

Position

  • Prone

Surgical Field

  • Antiseptic applied

Draping

  • Prepped and draped in standard sterile fashion

Pre-medication

  • Propofol given in divided doses and titrated to effect
  • Total dose of 400 mg Propofol

Operative Description

Colonoscopy, flexible, proximal to splenic flexure; diagnostic, with or without collection of specimen(s) by brushing or washing, with or without colon decompression (separate procedure) (45378)

Operation Description

  • Olympus colonoscope used
  • Colonoscope inserted
  • Scope advanced through the colon
  • Scope advanced through sigmoid to the cecum
  • Colon examined
  • No Polyps found
  • Scope withdrawn and retroflexed in the rectum
  • Small internal hemorrhoids identified
  • Hemorrhoids removed
  • Time withdrawal
  • Over 10 minutes

Discharge and Condition

Estimated blood loss

  • 0 mL or less

Sponge/needle/instrument count

  • Correct x 2

Discharge

  • Surgical day care recovery

Condition

  • Stable

DVT Prophylaxis

  • Not applicable

Specimen

  • None

Complications

  • No complications

Comments

  • Patient tolerated procedure well.

Signature

  • Signed by Gastroenterology Surgery, MD at 8:26 PM Thursday, December 20, 2012
